member.name: M:Vuforia.IAreaTargetCapture.CreateCapture
member.summary: Create a new capture with the specified configuration
member.remarks: Any previously created capture has to be destroyed first. The created capture has status INITIALIZED.

member.name: M:Vuforia.IAreaTargetCapture.Start
member.summary: Start the capture
member.remarks: This switches the capture to status PREPARING if not already done so. Fails if the capture is not in INITIALIZED state

member.name: M:Vuforia.IAreaTargetCapture.Stop
member.summary: Stop the capture
member.remarks: The capture stops data acquisition, and switches to status STOPPED. Fails if the capture is not in PREPARING, CAPTURING or PAUSED state.

member.name: M:Vuforia.IAreaTargetCapture.Pause
member.summary: Pause the capture
member.remarks: The capture pauses data acquisition, and switches to status PAUSED. Fails if the capture is not in PREPARING or CAPTURING state.

member.name: M:Vuforia.IAreaTargetCapture.Resume
member.summary: Resume the capture
member.remarks: The capture resumes data acquisition, and switches to either PREPARING or CAPTURING. Fails if the capture is not in PAUSED state.

member.name: M:Vuforia.IAreaTargetCapture.Generate(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Generate the target from the captured data
member.param: Target name for the capture. It is required to respect the following restrictions: Length: 1 - 64 characters Allowed ASCII characters: numerals, literals, dash, underscore
Target folder to save the capture
Generate authoring artifacts for the target
If set to true, make sure that "generateAuthoringFiles" is set to true, too
Generates then area target database files
member.remarks: This function generates an Area Target from the Area Target Capture instance. The capture is required to have status STOPPED, only then will it generate a target from the captured data. If the configuration is valid, the capture switches to status GENERATING, and returns true. If the configuration is invalid, false is returned, and the optional error parameter will hold an error code that reflects the cause of the error.

Area Target generation runs in the background, and when it completes the capture switches back to status STOPPED. The generation specific status info values report GENERATION_SUCCESS on successful generation, or hold one of the GENERATION_ERROR codes to report the failure cause. If Area Target generation was canceled, status info holds the value GENERATION_CANCELED.

A target can only be generated if the capture accumulated sufficient data to switch from the PREPARING status to the CAPTURING status. If that is not the case, the error code will report INSUFFICIENT_DATA.

member.name: M:Vuforia.IAreaTargetCapture.Destroy
member.summary: Destroy the capture
member.remarks: The capture will be cancelled if it is running

member.name: P:Vuforia.IAreaTargetCapture.Status
member.summary: Get status of the capture
member.remarks: Always gives a well defined state

member.name: P:Vuforia.IAreaTargetCapture.StatusInfo
member.summary: Get additional status info for the capture

member.name: P:Vuforia.IAreaTargetCapture.GenerationProgress
member.summary: Get progress information of the current generation in the range [0.0f, 1.0f]
member.remarks: Note that the capture has to be in status GENERATING or COMPLETED for this call to succeed. Otherwise this call will throw an exception

member.name: M:Vuforia.IAreaTargetCapture.GetGenerationTimeEstimate(System.Int32@)
member.summary: Gets the estimated time remaining to complete the current generation in seconds.
member.remarks: The capture has to be in status GENERATING or COMPLETED for this call to succeed. It may take few seconds after the generation started for the time estimate to become available.

member.name: M:Vuforia.IAreaTargetCapture.CancelGeneration
member.summary: Cancel target generation
member.remarks: A helper function to abort a running target generation. If the target generation has been canceled successfully, then status info will hold GENERATION_CANCELED.
This function blocks until target generation has aborted
Returns true if the capture is in status GENERATING, false otherwise.

member.name: M:Vuforia.CameraController.EnableAutomaticFocusPointSelection(System.Boolean)
member.summary: This method can be used to toggle automatic setting of the focus plane on HoloLens. It should only be called after Vuforia has started (e.g. VuforiaStartedCallback) By default, this is set to true, and Vuforia will automatically set the focus plane to the last detected target. However, if an the focus plane should be set to a hologram significantly offset from a target, this method should be used to disable automatic focus plane setting and it should be done from application code instead

member.name: T:Vuforia.CylinderMeshFactory
member.summary: This class creates a mesh for a cylinder, cone, or conical frustum. The resulting mesh contains vertex positions, normals, and texture coordinates. The resulting mesh contains inward and outward faces and can therefore be viewed double-sided. The resulting mesh has one, two, or three submeshes: side geometry, top geometry (optional), bottom geometry (optional)

member.name: M:Vuforia.CylinderMeshFactory.CreateCylinderMesh(System.Single,System.Single,System.Single,System.Int32,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Create a mesh for a cylinder, cone, or conical frustum.
member.param: Distance between point on top circle and corresponding point on bottom circle. Height for cylinders, slant height for cones.
Top diameter. For an upward cone it is zero. For a cylinder it is equal to the bottom diameter.
Bottom diameter. For a downward cone it is zero. For a cylinder it is equal to the top diameter.
Tesselation of the mesh is defined by setting the number of vertices per circle.
Define if optional top geometry should be generated.
Define if optional bottom geometry should be generated.
material used for the inside of the cylinder mesh

member.name: M:Vuforia.CylinderMeshFactory.CreateCylinderMesh(UnityEngine.Mesh,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single,System.Int32,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Create a mesh for a cylinder, cone, or conical frustum.
member.param: Existing mesh which can be modified. A new mesh will be created when this one is null.
Distance between point on top circle and corresponding point on bottom circle. Height for cylinders, slant height for cones.
Top diameter. For an upward cone it is zero. For a cylinder it is equal to the bottom diameter.
Bottom diameter. For a downward cone it is zero. For a cylinder it is equal to the top diameter.
Tesselation of the mesh is defined by setting the number of vertices per circle.
Define if optional top geometry should be generated.
Define if optional bottom geometry should be generated.
material used for the inside of the cylinder mesh

member.name: M:Vuforia.CylinderMeshFactory.AddSealingTriangles(System.Collections.Generic.List{UnityEngine.Vector3},System.Boolean)
member.summary: Create a circle for top or bottom geometry. Positions, normals, and texture coordinates are added.
member.param: Vertices of circle, must be parallel to xz-plane
define whether the circle is for the top or for the bottom geometry
member.returns: return face indices

member.summary: Dates are written in the ISO 8601 format, e.g. "2012-03-21T05:40Z".

member.name: F:Vuforia.Newtonsoft.Json.DateFormatHandling.MicrosoftDateFormat
member.summary: Dates are written in the Microsoft JSON format, e.g. "\/Date(1198908717056)\/".

member.name: T:Vuforia.Newtonsoft.Json.DateParseHandling
member.summary: Specifies how date formatted strings, e.g. "\/Date(1198908717056)\/" and "2012-03-21T05:40Z", are parsed when reading JSON text.

member.name: F:Vuforia.Newtonsoft.Json.DateParseHandling.None
member.summary: Date formatted strings are not parsed to a date type and are read as strings.

member.name: F:Vuforia.Newtonsoft.Json.DateParseHandling.DateTime
member.summary: Date formatted strings, e.g. "\/Date(1198908717056)\/" and "2012-03-21T05:40Z", are parsed to .

member.name: F:Vuforia.Newtonsoft.Json.DateParseHandling.DateTimeOffset
member.summary: Date formatted strings, e.g. "\/Date(1198908717056)\/" and "2012-03-21T05:40Z", are parsed to .

member.name: T:Vuforia.Newtonsoft.Json.DateTimeZoneHandling
member.summary: Specifies how to treat the time value when converting between string and .

member.name: F:Vuforia.Newtonsoft.Json.DateTimeZoneHandling.Local
member.summary: Treat as local time. If the object represents a Coordinated Universal Time (UTC), it is converted to the local time.

member.name: F:Vuforia.Newtonsoft.Json.DateTimeZoneHandling.Utc
member.summary: Treat as a UTC. If the object represents a local time, it is converted to a UTC.

member.name: F:Vuforia.Newtonsoft.Json.DateTimeZoneHandling.Unspecified
member.summary: Treat as a local time if a is being converted to a string. If a string is being converted to , convert to a local time if a time zone is specified.

member.name: F:Vuforia.Newtonsoft.Json.DateTimeZoneHandling.RoundtripKind
member.summary: Time zone information should be preserved when converting.

member.name: T:Vuforia.Newtonsoft.Json.DefaultValueHandling
member.summary: Specifies default value handling options for the .

member.name: F:Vuforia.Newtonsoft.Json.DefaultValueHandling.Include
member.summary: Include members where the member value is the same as the member's default value when serializing objects. Included members are written to JSON. Has no effect when deserializing.

member.name: F:Vuforia.Newtonsoft.Json.DefaultValueHandling.Ignore
member.summary: Ignore members where the member value is the same as the member's default value when serializing objects so that is is not written to JSON. This option will ignore all default values (e.g. null for objects and nullable types; 0 for integers, decimals and floating point numbers; and false for booleans). The default value ignored can be changed by placing the on the property.

member.name: F:Vuforia.Newtonsoft.Json.DefaultValueHandling.Populate
member.summary: Members with a default value but no JSON will be set to their default value when deserializing.

member.name: F:Vuforia.Newtonsoft.Json.DefaultValueHandling.IgnoreAndPopulate
member.summary: Ignore members where the member value is the same as the member's default value when serializing objects and sets members to their default value when deserializing.

member.name: T:Vuforia.Newtonsoft.Json.FloatFormatHandling
member.summary: Specifies float format handling options when writing special floating point numbers, e.g. , and with .

member.name: F:Vuforia.Newtonsoft.Json.FloatFormatHandling.String
member.summary: Write special floating point values as strings in JSON, e.g. "NaN", "Infinity", "-Infinity".

member.name: F:Vuforia.Newtonsoft.Json.FloatFormatHandling.Symbol
member.summary: Write special floating point values as symbols in JSON, e.g. NaN, Infinity, -Infinity. Note that this will produce non-valid JSON.

member.name: F:Vuforia.Newtonsoft.Json.FloatFormatHandling.DefaultValue
member.summary: Write special floating point values as the property's default value in JSON, e.g. 0.0 for a property, null for a property.

member.name: T:Vuforia.Newtonsoft.Json.FloatParseHandling
member.summary: Specifies how floating point numbers, e.g. 1.0 and 9.9, are parsed when reading JSON text.

member.name: F:Vuforia.Newtonsoft.Json.FloatParseHandling.Double
member.summary: Floating point numbers are parsed to .

member.name: F:Vuforia.Newtonsoft.Json.FloatParseHandling.Decimal
member.summary: Floating point numbers are parsed to .

member.name: M:Vuforia.AreaTargetCaptureBehaviour.StartCapture
member.summary: Creates an Area Target capture and Starts capturing.

member.name: M:Vuforia.AreaTargetCaptureBehaviour.PauseCapture
member.summary: Pauses the Area Target capture.
member.remarks: The capture pauses data acquisition, and switches to status PAUSED. Fails if the capture is not in PREPARING or CAPTURING state.

members.member:
Resumes the Area Target capture.
The capture resumes data acquisition, and switches to either PREPARING or CAPTURING. Fails if the capture is not in PAUSED state. >

member.name: M:Vuforia.AreaTargetCaptureBehaviour.StopCapture
member.summary: Stops the Area Target capture.
member.remarks: The capture stops data acquisition, and switches to status STOPPED. Fails if the capture is not in PREPARING, CAPTURING or PAUSED state.

member.name: M:Vuforia.AreaTargetCaptureBehaviour.DestroyCapture
member.summary: Destroys the current capture. Cannot destroy the capture while it is Generating the target
member.remarks: The capture will be cancelled if it is running

member.name: M:Vuforia.AreaTargetCaptureBehaviour.GenerateTarget
member.summary: Generates the Target using the name retrieved from the TargetName property with current timestamp Resulting target name will be in the form of TargetName-yyyyMMdd-HHmmss which can be retrieved using the FileName property

member.name: M:Vuforia.AreaTargetCaptureBehaviour.GenerateTarget(System.String)
member.summary: Generates the target asynchronously. If the generation is successful then the capture is Destroyed. The capture switches to GENERATING and generates a target from the captured data. When generation successfully completes, the capture switches to the STOPPED state. If generation fails, StatusInfo will hold an error status that reflects the cause of the error.
member.param: Target name for the capture. It is required to respect the following restrictions: Length: 1 - 64 characters Allowed ASCII characters: numerals, literals, dash, underscore
member.remarks: A target can only be generated if the capture accumulated sufficient data to switch from the PREPARING state to the CAPTURING state.
If target generation fails with ERROR_NO_NETWORK_CONNECTION, ERROR_SERVICE_NOT_AVAILABLE or ERROR_CANCELED one may attempt to call this function again to successfully generate a target.

member.name: M:Vuforia.AreaTargetCaptureBehaviour.CancelTargetGeneration
member.summary: Cancels target generation asynchronously. If a generation has been canceled successfully, the capture will switch to CANCELED state. The latter allows the capture to call generate again to successfully generate a target.
member.remarks: Will do nothing if the status is not AreaTargetCaptureStatus.GENERATING.

member.name: T:Vuforia.IlluminationData
member.summary: Provides realtime data of real-world illumination calculations by ARKit, when used by Vuforia Fusion

member.name: P:Vuforia.IlluminationData.AmbientIntensity
member.summary:
The current ambient intensity for the scene measured in Lumens. The value may not be available on all platforms. When the value is unavailable NULL will be returned.
This value will be valid when ARKit is being used by Vuforia Fusion.

member.name: P:Vuforia.IlluminationData.AmbientColorTemperature
member.summary:
The current color temperature for the scene measured in Kelvin. The value may not be available on all platforms. When the value is unavailable NULL will be returned.
This value will be valid when ARKit is being used by Vuforia Fusion.

member.name: P:Vuforia.IlluminationData.IntensityCorrection
member.summary:
Returns a floating point intensity value which can be applied to a shader when rendering the color for an augmentation to reflect the ambient light in the scene.
Intensity correction usage is described here, https://library.vuforia.com/content/vuforia-library/en/articles/Solution/using-vuforia-fusion-illumination.html
Intensity correction is a value that can be applied directly to a shader. Values are in the range (0.0, 1.0), zero is black and 1.0 is white.
If rendering in gamma space divide by 0.466 (middle grey in gamma) and multiply by the final rendered color.
In a linear space use pow(intensityCorrection, 2.2)/0.18 pow(intensityCorrection, 2.2) converts to linear space and then the value is normalized by dividing by 0.18 middle grey in linear space.
The value will always be valid for use. 0.466 (middle grey) is used in cases where the platform does not supply a value.

member.name: P:Vuforia.IlluminationData.ColorCorrection
member.summary:
\returns a Vec4F which contains RGBA color correction values which can be applied to a shader when rendering the color for an augmentation to reflect the ambient light in the scene.
Color correction usage is described here, https://library.vuforia.com/content/vuforia-library/en/articles/Solution/using-vuforia-fusion-illumination.html
All values are reported in gamma space where gamma is 2.2. When used in a gamma space component wise multiply the values with the final calculated color.
In a linear color space convert to linear using pow(colorCorrection[i], 2.2) and then component wise multiply the values with the final calculated color component.
The values will always be valid for use. 1.0 is used in cases where the platform does not supply values.
This value will differ from the default when ARCore is being used by Vuforia Fusion.

member.summary: Initialize Vuforia. Used when "delayed initialization" has been selected in the VuforiaConfiguration, otherwise this happens automatically While running in the Unity Editor, it takes couple frames to initialize.

member.name: M:Vuforia.VuforiaApplication.Initialize(Vuforia.FusionProviderOption)
member.summary: Initialize Vuforia while specifying a configuration for the Fusion Provider. Used when "delayed initialization" has been selected in the VuforiaConfiguration.

member.name: M:Vuforia.VuforiaApplication.Initialize(System.String,System.IntPtr)
member.summary:
Initialize Vuforia while setting up the name of the library that is loaded dynamically and used as an external source of camera or other input data. The library must support the Vuforia Driver API and it must be placed inside the app package to be loaded properly. The exact path depends on the platform: - Android: [apk-root-dir]/lib/[architecture]/library.so - UWP: [appx-root-dir]/library.dll - iOS: [appx-root-dir]/Frameworks/library.framework
Vuforia will try to initialize and use the functionality provided by the Driver.
To disable the Vuforia Driver functionality the following must be done: - Call VuforiaApplication.Instance.Deinit() - Call VuforiaApplication.Instance.Initialize()
member.remarks: This functionality is currently only supported on Editor, Android, iOS and UWP platforms.
member.param: Full file name of the Driver library. Setting this to null or empty string, will disable the use of the Driver functionality.

Optional user defined data to be passed into the library when it gets loaded. Vuforia only forwards the data and doesn't process it in any way. This value can be accessed at any time throughout the Vuforia lifecycle, so it MUST be valid until Vuforia is de-initialized. Set to IntPtr.Zero if not needed.

member.name: T:Vuforia.WorldCenterMode
member.summary: The world center mode defines how the relative coordinates between Trackables and camera are translated into Unity world coordinates. If a world center is present the virtual camera in the Unity scene is transformed with respect to that. The world center mode is set through the Unity inspector.

member.summary: User defines a single Trackable that defines the world center.

member.name: F:Vuforia.WorldCenterMode.FIRST_TARGET
member.summary: Tracker uses the first Trackable that comes into view as the world center (world center changes during runtime).

member.name: F:Vuforia.WorldCenterMode.DEVICE
member.summary: The device/camera is considered the world center, trackables are positioned with respect to it.

member.name: T:Vuforia.CameraDevice.AndroidDevice.CameraField
member.summary: Camera fields are advanced properties of the camera Camera fields represent advanced camera properties and capture parameters such as exposure compensation, ISO and others. A field may be read only (e.g. maximum exposure compensation value) or read-write (e.g. exposure compensation value). Camera fields are accessed as key-value pairs, where the value may be one of multiple basic types. Camera fields are highly platform dependent and the keys to identify a given property and available values to set will vary across operating system, operating system version, camera API version and the device model itself. Furthermore the behavior of the camera driver wrt. these fields is highly fragmented. Thus CameraFields should only be used for specific use case and devices. All of the Camera field APIs shall be called only after initializing the CameraDevice. Camera Fields are currently only implemented for Android. Finally setting advanced camera parameters may adversely affect Vuforia tracking performance as well as cause functional issues.

members.member: Null terminated array of characters (Ascii)
64 bit signed integer
Single precision floating point
Boolean
Array of two 32 bit signed integer

member.name: T:Vuforia.FusionProviderOption
member.summary: Options for the Fusion Provider configuration. Use VuforiaApplication.Instance.Initialize(FusionProviderOption) to initialize Vuforia with the selected configuration.

member.name: F:Vuforia.FusionProviderOption.PREFER_PLATFORM_FUSION_PROVIDER
member.summary: When initializing Vuforia, try to use the platform Fusion Provider. If not supported by the device, Vuforia will automatically fallback to the next best configuration available.

member.name: F:Vuforia.FusionProviderOption.VUFORIA_FUSION_ONLY
member.summary: When initializing Vuforia, do not try to use the platform Fusion Provider and use the Vuforia Fusion Provider instead.

member.name: T:Vuforia.FusionProviderType
member.summary:
Used when calling GetActiveFusionProvider()
Vuforia Fusion is a capability, introduced with Vuforia 7, that is designed to provide the best possible AR experience on a wide range of devices. Fusion solves the problem of fragmentation in AR-enabling technologies, including cameras, sensors, chipsets, and software frameworks such as ARKit, ARCore and Windows Holographic. It senses the capabilities of the underlying device and fuses them with Vuforia features, allowing developers to rely on a single Vuforia API for an optimal AR experience.
The FusionProviderType enums provide advanced developers with a way to control which technologies Fusion will use. Developers using these APIs should be aware: - of the functionality provided by the underlying platforms - of the technology involved in enabling AR - of the robustness of the various options - that features such as GroundPlane will cease to work. ModelTargets will operate in a less robust manner if VUFORIA_VISION_ONLY is selected.

member.name: F:Vuforia.FusionProviderType.UNKNOWN
member.summary: Fusion provider is unknown.

member.name: F:Vuforia.FusionProviderType.VISION_ONLY
member.summary: Use vision-based Fusion only. Please note that not all Vuforia Engine features are supported when using this provider.

member.name: F:Vuforia.FusionProviderType.SENSOR_FUSION
member.summary: Use Vuforia-provided technology for Fusion. Vuforia Engine will make use of camera and IMU information to try to create a tracking experience that, when compared to vision-only, is more robust to erratic motions and sparse or featureless environments.

member.name: F:Vuforia.FusionProviderType.PLATFORM_SENSOR_FUSION
member.summary: Use platform-provided technology for Fusion. Vuforia Engine will make use of tracking services offered by the underlying platform, such as ARKit on iOS, ARCore on Android, or Windows Holographic on UWP.

member.name: M:Vuforia.CloudRecoBehaviour.EnableObservers(Vuforia.CloudRecoBehaviour.CloudRecoSearchResult,System.String)
member.summary:
Enable this search result for tracking.
Activates an Observer for local detection and tracking of this target. returns a new ImageTargetBehaviour attached to a new game object with the given name. Note that this call may result in an earlier Observer that was enabled for tracking to be destroyed, including its ObserverBehaviour. Thus it is not advised to hold a reference to an earlier created Observer after calling EnableTracking again.

member.name: M:Vuforia.CloudRecoBehaviour.EnableObservers(Vuforia.CloudRecoBehaviour.CloudRecoSearchResult,UnityEngine.GameObject)
member.summary:
Enable this search result for tracking.
Activates an Observer for local detection and tracking of this target. If the given game object has no ImageTargetBehaviour, a new one will be created. Note that this call may result in an earlier Observer that was enabled for tracking to be destroyed, including its ObserverBehaviour. Thus it is not advised to hold a reference to an earlier created Observer after calling EnableTracking again.

member.name: M:Vuforia.CloudRecoBehaviour.ClearObservers(System.Boolean)
member.summary:
Clears all targets enabled for observers
Destroys all Observers that have been created via EnableObserving().

member.summary:

Earlier search result instances are destroyed

member.summary:

Pass in the user/password for authenticating with the cloud reco server.

member.name: F:Vuforia.DataSetTrackableBehaviour.TargetMotionHint.STATIC
member.summary: Optimize performance for objects that remain at the same location throughout the experience. Setting this value allows %Vuforia to reduce CPU and power consumption when PositionalDeviceTracker is enabled.

member.name: F:Vuforia.DataSetTrackableBehaviour.TargetMotionHint.ADAPTIVE
member.summary: Automatically optimize performance for experiences ranging from mostly static objects to moving objects. \note Some target types do not support the full motion range, e.g. Model Target only allows limited object motion. Refer to the specific target documentation for more information on their behavior.

member.name: F:Vuforia.DataSetTrackableBehaviour.TargetMotionHint.DYNAMIC
member.summary: Optimize performance for objects that are moved constantly, e.g. for interacting with the environment.

member.name: T:Vuforia.DevicePoseBehaviour
member.summary: Represents the device, such as a phone or a digital eyewear device, of which a position is tracked enabling/disabling the Device MonoBehaviour causes the device to start/stop being tracked

member.name: P:Vuforia.DevicePoseBehaviour.StaticMode
member.summary: Get if the device pose is set to static

member.name: M:Vuforia.DevicePoseBehaviour.SetStaticMode(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Configures the device pose for statically mounted devices, e.g. a mobile device on a tripod looking at an object.
member.remarks: In such a case, standard Vuforia fusion tracking will not succeed to initialize for lack of movement. This setting configures the device tracker to return static poses to stabilize tracking e.g. in case of the object being occluded. This method can be called while Vuforia is running, however, doing so will cause the device pose observer to be reset.
member.returns: True if the value could be set

member.name: M:Vuforia.DevicePoseBehaviour.RecenterPose
member.summary: Recenters the device pose to the current transform of the ARCamera

member.name: M:Vuforia.DevicePoseBehaviour.Reset
member.summary: Reset the device pose observer On some platforms a new world coordinate system may be created with the device's current position and orientation as the origin. On some platforms the underlying Vuforia Fusion provider may also be reset. Any internal data will be destroyed.
member.returns: true if positional device tracking was reset correctly

member.name: T:Vuforia.GuideViewCameraBehaviour
member.summary: This class represents a Guide View Camera, which can be used to configure the guide view pose for detection of a Model Target. When attaching this component to a game object, a Camera will be created automatically. This Camera is only used at Editor time to faciliate the Application developer to adjust the Pose visually by looking at the Camera preview. At runtime, the Camera component will be automatically disabled.

member.name: P:Vuforia.VuMarkBehaviour.VuMarkUserData
member.summary: Gets the user data associated with this template that comes from the dataset. If there is no VuMark use data associated with this template, an empty string is returned.

members.member:
Sets or gets whether the VuMark has a changing background per instance, signaling to SDK how to track it.
Setting TrackingFromRuntimeAppearance to true indicates that the SDK should track this type of VuMark based on what is seen by the camera and not assume the template background image is useful for tracking because the background can change per instance. Setting TrackingFromRuntimeAppearance to false indicates that the SDK should track this type of VuMark based on VuMark Template used to create the dataset. This is the default behavior.

member.name: M:Vuforia.VuMarkBehaviour.SetWidth(System.Single)
member.summary: Set the width (x-dimension) of the target in scene units. This will scale the target uniformly. The dataset has to be deactivated before changing the size. Make sure to set the same size for all instantiated behaviours of the same VuMark-template

member.name: M:Vuforia.VuMarkBehaviour.SetHeight(System.Single)
member.summary: Set the height (y-dimension) of the target in scene units. This will scale the target uniformly. The dataset has to be deactivated before changing the size. Make sure to set the same size for all instantiated behaviours of the same VuMark-template

member.summary: Clean the cache of previously seen VuMark instances that are not actively tracked now.
member.remarks: The cache is automatically cleaned whenever Vuforia is paused or when the authored VuMarkBehaviour that is being used as a template for all instances is disabled,

member.name: F:Vuforia.VuMarkInstancesManager.mUntrackedBehavioursCache
member.summary: VuMark behaviours that have been tracked once but are lost now. They are put into this cache so they can be fetched later again when a VuMark instance for that behaviour is tracked again

member.summary: Tracking is working normally.

member.summary: Not enough information yet for accurate tracking.

member.summary: The whole buffer (i.e. BufferWidth x BufferHeight) is copied to the texture. Width, height and format of texture will be updated to fit the input image.

member.name: M:Vuforia.Image.CopyToTexture(UnityEngine.Texture2D)
member.summary: Copies the image into the given texture. Width and height of texture will be updated to fit the input image. The image data is converted to the format of the texture. Only grayscale, RGB24 and RGBA32 are supported. Only the image portion defined by Width and Height is copied to the texture, not the whole buffer.

member.name: M:Vuforia.Image.CopyToTexture(UnityEngine.Texture2D,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Copies the image into the given texture. Width and height of texture will be updated to fit the input image. The image data is converted to the format of the texture. Only grayscale, RGB24 and RGBA32 are supported. Only the image portion defined by Width and Height is copied to the texture, not the whole buffer.
member.param: whether the image should be flipped in y-direction

member.name: T:Vuforia.ISessionRecorder

member.name: M:Vuforia.ISessionRecorder.StartRecording(System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Starts recording a Vuforia session. If the captureSensor parameter is set to false, the session recorder will only save the camera feed.
member.param: Determine if the session recorder should also record sensor data. Defaults to true.
Determine if the session recorder should also record audio. Defaults to false.

member.summary: Stops the current recording.

member.summary: Uses the platform's native share functionality to share the latest recorded Vuforia Session.
member.returns: true if the native share popup was shown. false otherwise.

member.name: M:Vuforia.ISessionRecorder.Clean
member.summary: Deletes ALL the existing recordings on the device.
member.returns: true if all the recordings were successfully deleted. false otherwise.

member.name: M:Vuforia.ISessionRecorder.GetRecordingStatus
member.summary: Returns the current status of the session recorder.

member.name: M:Vuforia.ISessionRecorder.GetRecordingStatusInfo
member.summary: Returns additional status info of the session recorder.

member.name: M:Vuforia.ISessionRecorder.GetSupportedSources
member.summary: Returns the sources supported by the device whose data can be recorded. The value is a bit-wise combination of the appropriate RecordingSource flags.

member.name: M:Vuforia.ISessionRecorder.GetDefaultSources
member.summary: Returns the sources that are appropriate for the current device to create AR session recordings The value is a bit-wise combination of the appropriate RecordingSource flags.

member.name: M:Vuforia.ISessionRecorder.GetDeviceCapabilities
member.summary: Returns the sources supported by the device whose data can be recorded. The value is a bit-wise combination of the appropriate RecordingSource flags.
member.remarks: \deprecated ISessionRecorder.GetDeviceCapabilities is obsolete and will be removed soon. Please use ISessionRecorder.GetDefaultSources instead.

member.name: M:Vuforia.ISessionRecorder.GetRecordingPath
member.summary: Returns the path to the last successful recording. If called while recording, it returns the path to the current recording. It is recommended to preserve a copy of this path if a list of all recordings is needed. The session recorder does not keep this information.

Start recording a Vuforia session. Internal method in which the sources, the frame rate, the image scale and the format of the recording can be configured.

member.name: T:Vuforia.SessionRecorderBehaviour
member.summary: The session recorder allows the user to record Vuforia sessions for playback in the editor and on a device

member.name: M:Vuforia.SessionRecorderBehaviour.StartRecording
member.summary: Starts the recording of a Vuforia session. It uses the value assigned to the field CaptureSensorsData to configure the Session Recorder. Invokes the OnRecordingStarted event after the recording is started. Called from the Record button in the Session Recorder UI.

member.name: M:Vuforia.SessionRecorderBehaviour.StopRecording
member.summary: Stops recording. The method updates the Recording Status and invokes the OnRecordingStopped event. Called from the Stop button in the Session Recorder UI.

member.name: M:Vuforia.SessionRecorderBehaviour.CleanStorage
member.summary: Deletes ALL the existing recordings on the device. The method invokes the OnStorageCleaned event with a value of true after the storage has been successfully cleaned. It is not allowed to clean the storage while a recording is in progress. In that case, or if an error occurs, the OnStorageCleaned event will be invoked with a value of false. Called from the Session Recorder UI.

member.name: M:Vuforia.SessionRecorderBehaviour.ShareRecording
member.summary: Uses the platform's native share functionality to share the latest recorded Vuforia Session. This method must be called AFTER a recording was successfully saved on disk. In that vase, the OnShareRequested event will be invoked with a value of true. If this method is called before any session has been recorder or if the native share window is not shown, the OnShareRequested event will be invoked with a value of false.

member.name: M:Vuforia.SessionRecorderBehaviour.GetRecordingStatus
member.summary: Returns the current Recording Status.

member.name: M:Vuforia.SessionRecorderBehaviour.GetRecordingStatusInfo
member.summary: Returns additional status info of the session recorder.

member.name: M:Vuforia.SessionRecorderBehaviour.GetSupportedSources
member.summary: Returns the sources supported by the device whose data can be recorded. The value is a bit-wise combination of the appropriate RecordingSource flags.

member.name: M:Vuforia.SessionRecorderBehaviour.GetDefaultSources
member.summary: Returns the sources that are appropriate for the current device to create AR session recordings The value is a bit-wise combination of the appropriate RecordingSource flags.

member.name: M:Vuforia.SessionRecorderBehaviour.GetDeviceCapabilities
member.summary: Returns the sources supported by the device whose data can be recorded.
member.remarks: \deprecated SessionRecorderBehaviour.GetDeviceCapabilities is obsolete and will be removed soon. Please use SessionRecorderBehaviour.GetSupportedSources instead.

member.name: M:Vuforia.SessionRecorderBehaviour.GetRecordingPath
member.summary: Returns the path to the last successful recording. If called while recording, it returns the path to the current recording. It is recommended to preserve a copy of this path if a list of all recordings is needed. The session recorder does not keep this information.

member.name: T:Vuforia.RecordingStatus
member.summary: Status of the session recorder.

member.name: F:Vuforia.RecordingStatus.INITIALIZED
member.summary: The recording has been created and can be started.

member.name: F:Vuforia.RecordingStatus.RUNNING
member.summary: The recording is in progress.

member.summary: The recording has stopped. It cannot be started again. Check the status info for further details.

member.summary: Recording start error.

member.name: F:Vuforia.RecordingStartError.NONE
member.summary: No error

member.name: F:Vuforia.RecordingStartError.INTERNAL
member.summary: Starting failed due to an internal error

member.name: F:Vuforia.RecordingStartError.ANOTHER_RECORDING_RUNNING
member.summary: Failed to start a recording because another recording is already in progress. Stop the other recording before starting a new one.

member.name: F:Vuforia.RecordingStartError.ENGINE_NOT_RUNNING
member.summary: Recording cannot be started as the engine is not running

member.name: F:Vuforia.RecordingStartError.INVALID_STATUS
member.summary: Cannot start a recording that is not in the initialized state. Create a new recording.

member.name: F:Vuforia.RecordingStartError.FILE_CREATION
member.summary: Cannot start the recording because the output file could not be created

member.name: F:Vuforia.RecordingStartError.UNKNOWN_ORIENTATION
member.summary: Device is in an unknown or unsupported orientation

member.name: F:Vuforia.RecordingStartError.DATA_SOURCE
member.summary: Failed to start recording from some of the selected data sources. This could happen if e.g. another application has exclusive access to a source.

member.name: F:Vuforia.RecordingStartError.INSUFFICIENT_FREE_SPACE
member.summary: Cannot start a recording as there isn't sufficient free space on the device to store it

member.name: F:Vuforia.RecordingStartError.DATA_FLAGS_NOT_SUPPORTED
member.summary: One or more requested data flags are not supported on the current device

member.name: F:Vuforia.RecordingStartError.UNITY_PLAYMODE_NOT_SUPPORTED
member.summary: Failed to start recording because it is not supported in Unity PlayMode.

member.name: T:Vuforia.TrackingOptimization
member.summary: Optimize tracking quality and robustness for different target types

member.name: F:Vuforia.TrackingOptimization.DEFAULT
member.summary: Best tracking performance for the majority of use cases and targets.

member.name: F:Vuforia.TrackingOptimization.LOW_FEATURE_OBJECTS
member.summary: Optimize tracking for objects with smooth, untextured surfaces, that lack features and detailed structures, including cars, sheet metal parts and many inustrial objects.
member.remarks: Do not use for objects that move while being tracked.

member.name: F:Vuforia.TrackingOptimization.AR_CONTROLLER
member.summary: Optimize tracking for use cases where small, handheld fast moving targets are used like a AR/VR controller. Tracking will be less stable if the object is stationary.

member.name: T:Vuforia.TrackingOptimizationConversion
member.summary: Optimize tracking quality and robustness for different target types

member.name: M:Vuforia.TrackingOptimizationConversion.FromMotionHintAndTrackingMode(Vuforia.DataSetTrackableBehaviour.TargetMotionHint,Vuforia.ModelTargetBehaviour.ModelTargetTrackingMode)
member.summary:
Converts the MotionHint/TrackingMode to the new TrackingOptimization using this mapping (https://vuforia.atlassian.net/browse/FOCUSSDK-75212):
| TrackingMode | MotionHint | TrackingOptimization | |--------------|------------|----------------------| | DEFAULT | STATIC | DEFAULT (1) | | DEFAULT | ADPATIVE | DEFAULT | | DEFAULT | DYNAMIC | AR_CONTROLLER | | CAR | STATIC | LOW_FEATURE_OBJECTS | | CAR | ADAPTIVE | DEFAULT | | CAR | DYNAMIC | AR_CONTROLLER | | SCAN | STATIC | DEFAULT (1)(2) | | SCAN | ADAPTIVE | DEFAULT (2) | | SCAN | DYNAMIC | AR_CONTROLLER (2) |
(1) STATIC motion hint is no longer supported and therefore an error message should be shown in the Model Target editor
(2) Tracking uses the scan thresholds (Determined on native)

member.name: T:System.Runtime.Serialization.Formatters.FormatterAssemblyStyle
member.summary: Indicates the method that will be used during deserialization for locating and loading assemblies.

member.name: F:System.Runtime.Serialization.Formatters.FormatterAssemblyStyle.Simple
member.summary: In simple mode, the assembly used during deserialization need not match exactly the assembly used during serialization. Specifically, the version numbers need not match as the LoadWithPartialName method is used to load the assembly.

member.name: F:System.Runtime.Serialization.Formatters.FormatterAssemblyStyle.Full
member.summary: In full mode, the assembly used during deserialization must match exactly the assembly used during serialization. The Load method of the Assembly class is used to load the assembly.
